item.title: single PR single commit
item.description: When you are using git in a forking workflow, your local commits and pushes will end up on your fork of the repository you are contributing to. In general a PR should contain single commit (at least the projects that I have worked on) so before you send your PR you will generally want all your commits (changes) in one single commit. In this case there are two options, one is to “squash” all your commits into a single commit or the alternative is to continuously amend each commit to your first one.

item.title: keeping a fork in sync
item.description: Commands to keep a fork in sync with the upstream repo.
